title: A Helpful New Direction In Retirement Research
author: Seeking Alpha
dc:creator: Seeking Alpha
description: New research by Moshe Milevsky distinguishes between chronological age and biological age. Someone who has lived 60 years may be as fit as a 50-year-old or may be biologically equivalent to a 70-year-old. Thus, the implications for asset allocation and insurance coverage for two people both aged 60 may be very different. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

itunes:summary:
New research by Moshe Milevsky distinguishes between chronological age and biological age. Someone who has lived 60 years may be as fit as a 50-year-old or may be biologically equivalent to a 70-year-old. Thus, the implications for asset allocation and insurance coverage for two people both aged 60 may be very different.
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices
